pullRequest.title: Add /topic/message/:consensusTimestamp API
pullRequest.bodyText:
Detailed description:
Adds a new /api/v1/topic/message/:consensusTimestamp REST API
Which issue(s) this PR fixes:
Fixes #616
Special notes for your reviewer:
Checklist

 Documentation added
 Tests updated

nodes.bodyText: Should be snake case to match the others: topic_id
To match transactions API, we should format it the same way using utils.nsToSecNs

We encode memo in other APIs to base64, so we should use that instead of hex for these byte[] fields. Also, base64 is more efficient in that it uses less characters: Hex will take two characters for each byte - Base64 takes 4 characters for every 3 bytes.
This should technically compare against config.hedera.mirror.shard and not assume shard is 0. It will be hard to track down all these places that hardcode shard later if we ever have multiple shards.
nit: Should avoid string concatenation and use backticks for this and other logging statements: Multiple rows found for topicId ${topicId} and seqNum ${seqNum}
nit: there's a results.rowCount field that gives you this value with better perf

You should add a limit = 1, to ensure you only get one result.
I also had this message as overkill and took the first occurrence and warned on this instead of erroring.
I think the limit would be best, I don't mind how you handle multiple if it happens.

nit: no need to change here but we should standardize on our error response format.
In transactions.js and accounts.js I see place where non json is returned. And in this PR we have messages : [{...}] and then message: {...} in other cases.
I have a separate PR where I'm addressing this but just pointing it out here so both formats are presented.
